00:00:01:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:01:190000.Dialogue: Wow, Sheldon, I cannot believe you made up your own game.

00:00:08:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:08:190000.Dialogue: It's like the slogan says, "The Physics is theoretical, but the fun is real."

00:00:14:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:14:060000.Dialogue: We must not be playing it right.

00:00:18:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:18:070000.Dialogue: All right, five. One, two, three, four, five. Oh, wow, look at that. My Department of Defense research grant is renewed.

00:00:26:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:26:140000.Dialogue: Oh! Great roll! Now you can demolish your Soviet-style cyclotron and build the large Hadron Collider.

00:00:36:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:36:220000.Dialogue: You're a natural at this, Penny. And as the first beta testers, you two'll have quite the edge when we play with Wolowitz and Koothrappali on Sunday.

00:00:44:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:44:060000.Dialogue: Oh, gee, Sheldon, I don't think we can play on Sunday.

00:00:49:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:49:130000.Dialogue: Because of the reasons that Penny will now tell you. Penny?

00:00:54:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:54:080000.Dialogue: Actually, I have to pick up my friend Justin from the airport.

00:00:56:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:56:190000.Dialogue: There you go-- she has to pick up her friend Justin at the airport. And I can't play 'cause I'm going with her-- right?

00:01:02:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:02:130000.Dialogue: Um, yeah, if you want. I mean, there may not be room. He's got a lot of stuff-- like guitars and amplifiers.

00:01:08:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:08:020000.Dialogue: Wait. What are you talking about?

00:01:11:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:11:040000.Dialogue: Pay attention, Leonard. That's why she can't play on Sunday.

00:01:18:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:18:220000.Dialogue: Yeah-- my friend from Omaha; plays the guitar. Anyway, he's coming to L.A. looking for some session work, so I told him he could just crash on my couch for a few weeks.

00:01:25:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:25:210000.Dialogue: Come on, Leonard-- if you roll a six, Penny dies horribly in a nuclear meltdown.

00:01:29:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:29:190000.Dialogue: See what I mean when I say the fun is real?

00:01:33:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:33:060000.Dialogue: Hang on. Some guy is going to be sleeping on your couch?

00:01:36:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:36:220000.Dialogue: He's not "some guy." He's my friend.

00:01:39:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:39:120000.Dialogue: So by "friend," do you mean "friend friend," "gay friend," or "ex boyfriend "who you're now platonic with but still might have a thing for you friend"?

00:01:51:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:51:060000.Dialogue: Oh, ho-ho, a definitely not gay musician sleeping on my girlfriend's couch. Yippee.

00:01:57:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:57:070000.Dialogue: Okay, we went out a little bit, a long time ago. But we were never like "going out."

00:02:02:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:02:110000.Dialogue: Okay, not to be pedantic, but last I checked "went out" was in fact the past tense of "going out"-- which I think we all know is a popular euphemism for "saw each other naked."

00:02:15:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:15:160000.Dialogue: Do you have a problem with Justin staying with me?

00:02:22:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:22:220000.Dialogue: You know what? Don't talk to me like I'm an idiot.

00:02:25:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:25:130000.Dialogue: I'm not talking to you like you're an idiot! I'm saying the whole idea is idiotic!

00:02:28:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:28:210000.Dialogue: "You accidentally stare at a helium-argon laser. Lose one turn and a retina."

00:02:33:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:33:210000.Dialogue: How is that not talking to me like I'm an idiot? It's my friend, it's my couch, and it's my freakin' life!

00:02:40:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:40:170000.Dialogue: You know what? It is your life. If you want to have some stupid guitarist stay on your couch, then fine. Why don't you just rent some bun beds and invite The Black Eyed Peas?!

00:02:50:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:50:070000.Dialogue: Hey, if I want to invite the entire lineup of Lollapalooza to sleep in my apartment, I will, and it's none of your business!

00:02:55:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:55:180000.Dialogue: Are you listening to yourself? Do you know how childish you sound right now?

00:02:58:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:58:060000.Dialogue: Oh, now I'm a child? Well, at least I'm not an idiot anymore!

00:03:00:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:00:220000.Dialogue: (blender grinding) The two aren't mutually exclusive!

00:03:02:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:02:140000.Dialogue: Oh, you are such a-- What the hell is he doing?!

00:03:06:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:06:060000.Dialogue: He's drowning us out. He doesn't like fighting.

00:03:08:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:08:230000.Dialogue: Sheldon, just stop! ok, the fight is over! Oh, and FYI, you never even heard of The Black Eyed Peas until you met me!

00:03:15:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:15:100000.Dialogue: I heard of 'em! Didn't know they were a band.

00:03:22:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:22:110000.Dialogue: Sheldon, she's gone. You can turn off the blender.

00:03:31:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:31:070000.Dialogue: Has your relationship reached its inevitable ugly end?

00:03:36:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:36:020000.Dialogue: No, we just had a little spat.

00:03:38:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:38:190000.Dialogue: Look on the bright side. As the result of Penny's forfeit, you have become the world's first winner of "Research Lab." Would you like a commemorative snow cone?

00:04:19:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:19:060000.Dialogue: I don't get how she can just announce that an old boyfriend is going to be sleeping on her couch.

00:04:23:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:23:210000.Dialogue: Hey, I thought of a game we can play in the car.

00:04:26:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:26:100000.Dialogue: I don't want to play a game, Sheldon.

00:04:27:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:27:210000.Dialogue: It's called "Scientists." Now, I will name three scientists, then you will put them in order of the size of their contribution to their respective fields. To make this game even more compelling, you must consider only the contribution of the man to the field, not the validity of the field itself. For example: Abu Musa Jabir ibn Hayn made a greater contribution to the discredited field of alchemy than Halbert Vanderplatt made to neurobiology. Okay, ready to have some fun?

00:04:53:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:53:230000.Dialogue: An old boyfriend who's definitely not gay. That's what a guy likes to hear-- "definitely."

00:04:59:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:59:030000.Dialogue: All right, I'll start with an easy one: Um, Isaac Newton, Madame Curie and Niels Bohr.

00:05:05:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:05:120000.Dialogue: And then I say one little thing and I end up being the bad guy!

00:05:08:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:08:050000.Dialogue: Hint: Madame Curie had her husband to help her.

00:05:11:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:11:120000.Dialogue: What am I supposed to say? "Sure, Penny, I'm cool with your old boyfriend sleeping in your apartment." "Well, Leonard, it doesn't matter if you're cool or not "because I'm Penny and I'm pretty and I can do whatever the hell I want!" "Oh, I get it! "You think you're doing me a favor just by being in a relationship with me!" "No, no, Leonard! I'm doing you a favor just by being in the same room as you!"

00:05:33:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:33:090000.Dialogue: I can't listen to the two of you fight anymore.

00:05:41:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:41:130000.Dialogue: Come on, come on, we're late.

00:05:42:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:42:200000.Dialogue: Calm down. We'll make the movie.

00:05:44:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:44:070000.Dialogue: I believe my alarm is appropriate, given the situation. The movie starts in 17 minutes, which means we'll need to make all the lights on Colorado Boulevard, plus skip the concession stand, and preshow urination.

00:05:53:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:53:200000.Dialogue: Oh, dude, I wish you had said something before pounded that last Red Bull.

00:05:59:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:59:090000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Go, go, Power Rangers, go!

00:06:06:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:06:010000.Dialogue: Hey. We're, uh, going to the movies.

00:06:08:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:08:140000.Dialogue: No, we're not. We're standing in the hallway, suffering through an awkward encounter.

00:06:15:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:15:140000.Dialogue: Hang on. They're showing a new digital part of Time Bandits. You wouldn't want to come, would you?

00:06:22:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:22:140000.Dialogue: All right, invitation pointlessly offered, invitation declined as expected, everyone's civil, nobody's fighting. Have a nice evening.

00:06:31:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:31:230000.Dialogue: Oh, take all the time you need.

00:06:37:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:37:210000.Dialogue: So, are we going to talk about last night?

00:06:43:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:43:210000.Dialogue: (imitates buzzer) Wrong answer. But thank you for playing.

00:06:46:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:46:010000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. This is stupid.

00:06:49:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:49:040000.Dialogue: Oh, there it is again! You think I'm stupid!

00:06:51:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:51:060000.Dialogue: No, there's a difference between being stupid and acting stupid.

00:06:54:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:54:020000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah? well, there's a difference between being a jerk and being an ass!

00:07:06:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:06:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, I don't think I need my preshow urination anymore.

00:07:12:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:12:050000.Dialogue: Leonard, when that woman moved in three years ago I told you not to talk to her, and now look. we're going to be late for the movies.

00:07:26:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:26:210000.Dialogue: Remember this one? Spider-Man loses a big fight and then his girlfriend breaks up with him. Hmm. Want me to get it for you? It'll help take your mind off things.

00:07:40:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:40:090000.Dialogue: Oh, we need to kill a couple hours till the next showing of Time Bandits.

00:07:43:050000.Speaker: Stuart
00:07:43:050000.Dialogue: Oh, well, no problem. I was thinking of closing early and going home, but let's face it, that's just a slightly smaller lonely room filled with comic books.

00:07:53:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:53:090000.Dialogue: Thanks, Stuart. Let me ask you something. Do you think it's okay for Penny to have an ex-boyfriend sleep on her couch?

00:08:01:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:01:040000.Dialogue: No, I mean, she's obviously way out of line.

00:08:03:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:03:210000.Dialogue: But if she dumps you, she'll have a new boyfriend by tomorrow morning and you'll have a new girlfriend when you figure out how to build one.

00:08:11:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:11:230000.Dialogue: So the only question is: how long until you fold?

00:08:14:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:14:230000.Dialogue: I am not going to fold.

00:08:16:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:16:180000.Dialogue: Well, excuse me, I don't think Penny's out of line at all. You don't own her. It's like my girl, Beyonce says "If you like it, you shoulda put a ring on it."

00:08:26:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:26:040000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: Come on. At the very least, when she found out Leonard was upset about it, she should've backed off.

00:08:31:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:31:180000.Dialogue: You mean like when a guy's upset because his friend agreed to take a cooking class with him and then doesn't show up because he's doing a juice fast with his mother?

00:08:38:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:38:090000.Dialogue: I didn't know you were upset about that.

00:08:41:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:41:160000.Dialogue: Really! Did you miss all the subtle indicators, like me saying, "Howard, I am upset."

00:08:46:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:46:230000.Dialogue: Maybe it means something different in this country. Back in India, it means you're upset with a guy named Howard!

00:08:53:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:53:100000.Dialogue: Sorry doesn't make up for the fact that I had to make chicken and rice with this vegan guy. Do you know what vegan chicken and rice is? Rice!

00:09:00:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:00:180000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, you think I was having fun, sitting around all night listening to my mother say, "Have you ever peed so much in your life?"

00:09:07:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:07:230000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, you are such a mama's boy.

00:09:10:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:10:220000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: Hey, don't bring my mother into this!

00:09:13:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:13:010000.Dialogue: You brought your mother into this!

00:09:14:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:14:090000.Dialogue: Stop it, both of you. All this fighting, I might as well be back with my parents! "Damn it, George, I told you if you didn't quit drinkin' I'd leave you!" "Well, I guess that makes you a liar. 'Cause I'm drunk as hell and you're still here!" "Stop yelling! You're making Sheldon cry!" "I'll tell you what's making Sheldon cry! That I let you name him Sheldon."

00:09:39:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:39:040000.Dialogue: Boy, what got him so upset?

00:09:42:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:42:050000.Dialogue: Oh, sure, you can tell when Sheldon's upset.

00:09:52:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:52:200000.Dialogue: Oh, thank you very much. Come back soon. With the other half of my tip.

00:10:01:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:01:170000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon. What are you doing here?

00:10:04:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:04:010000.Dialogue: This is a restaurant. It's lunchtime. I would think, as a waitress, you'd be familiar with the paradigm.

00:10:10:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:10:060000.Dialogue: No, I believe Leonard is waiting for you to come crawling back to him and apologize.

00:10:16:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:16:040000.Dialogue: I assumed that would be your attitude. Hence, my true purpose in coming here.

00:10:23:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:23:140000.Dialogue: Excuse me, miss. I'd like to order lunch.

00:10:33:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:33:030000.Dialogue: I have a few questions. First, I notice that you offer soup and a half-sandwich?

00:10:39:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:39:030000.Dialogue: Where exactly does the half-sandwich come from? Are you giving me half of someone else's sandwich, or do I have to wait for someone else in the restaurant to order the other half?

00:10:47:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:47:200000.Dialogue: No, no, Sheldon, they just make a half-sandwich.

00:10:50:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:50:020000.Dialogue: You can't make a half-sandwich. If it's the half of a whole sandwich, it's just a small sandwich.

00:10:55:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:55:130000.Dialogue: Okay, fine, it's soup and a small sandwich. Is that what you want?

00:10:59:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:59:140000.Dialogue: Of course not. I'll have my usual.

00:11:02:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:02:230000.Dialogue: Aren't you going to ask me if I want a beverage?

00:11:09:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:09:090000.Dialogue: Yes-- I want you to apologize to Leonard.

00:11:11:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:11:040000.Dialogue: I am not going to apologize. I've done nothing wrong. He is completely overreacting.

00:11:16:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:16:130000.Dialogue: Irrelevant. The disruption in your relationship is making my life intolerable.

00:11:19:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:19:200000.Dialogue: Well, I'm sorry, Sheldon, but this really isn't about you.

00:11:25:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:25:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, I'll be right there. Look, Sheldon, I have to go.

00:11:29:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:29:090000.Dialogue: All right, let's assume, ad argumentum, that in this case, Leonard is wrong.

00:11:34:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:34:170000.Dialogue: Considering the number of transgressions you've committed that he's overlooked, don't you think that, just this once, you could return the favor?

00:11:40:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:40:100000.Dialogue: I'm coming. Good-bye, Sheldon. What do you mean, transgressions I've committed?

00:11:50:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:50:140000.Dialogue: Were you under the impression that Leonard has no complaints about you?

00:11:53:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:53:210000.Dialogue: Like what?! Yeah, yeah, I see you. You're making a little check sign in the air. I got it. Just hold your horses.

00:12:01:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:01:060000.Dialogue: Your driving. The plethora of stuffed animals on your bed that stare at him during your amorous activities.

00:12:12:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:12:090000.Dialogue: That's actually from my list. But Leonard would be a fool if he didn't agree with it.

00:12:15:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:15:160000.Dialogue: Okay, if Leonard has so many problems with me, why hasn't he just said so?

00:12:19:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:19:100000.Dialogue: Because, according to him, you're oversensitive and have a temper.

00:12:21:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:21:150000.Dialogue: Oh, really? Well, then, do me a favor and tell Leonard that he can drop dead!

00:12:30:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:30:010000.Dialogue: And she wonders why she's constantly undertipped.

00:12:38:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:38:170000.Dialogue: Oh, good, you're home. I need you to do me a favor.

00:12:48:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:48:060000.Dialogue: Although, a few minutes ago would have been better.

00:12:50:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:50:150000.Dialogue: PENNY: I hear you don't like my stuffed animals, my driving or my punctuality.

00:12:55:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:55:080000.Dialogue: What? Who would tell you something like that? Why would you tell her something like that?

00:13:00:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:00:010000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter why he told me. It's true, isn't it?

00:13:02:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:02:230000.Dialogue: Okay, yeah, it's true, but I can live with that stuff. What I can't live with is you casually informing me that some guy's going to be staying in your apartment without even asking me first!

00:13:11:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:11:070000.Dialogue: That isn't even your problem! Your problem is you don't trust me!

00:13:14:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:14:080000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. Sheldon, have you ever once heard me say that I don't trust Penny? Sheldon? Where did he go?

00:13:21:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:21:090000.Dialogue: PENNY: Oh, your yelling must have freaked him out again.

00:13:23:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:23:210000.Dialogue: Where are you going?! You just walk away in the middle of an argument?!

00:13:25:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:25:190000.Dialogue: No. I'm going to go find your damn roommate before he hurts himself trying to cross the street or something!

00:13:32:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:32:210000.Dialogue: Oh, now I need your permission for that, too?!

00:13:35:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:35:050000.Dialogue: Well, I can't read your mind, Penny!

00:13:36:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:36:230000.Dialogue: Really? Why not? You're so smart, and I'm so dumb!

00:13:46:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:46:220000.Dialogue: KOOTHRAPPALI: Stop knocking! It's open! Please tell my parents that our dark matter research is at a critical juncture, and I can't come home for my cousin Sanjay's wedding.

00:13:54:230000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:13:54:230000.Dialogue: MRS. KOOTHRAPPALI: Sheldon, ask our son what we're supposed to say to Mr. and Mrs. Cheldry, whose daughter, Lakshmi is flying in from London, for the sole purpose of meeting him.

00:14:02:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:02:130000.Dialogue: I didn't ask you to set me up with Lakshmi.

00:14:05:200000.Speaker: Dr Koothrappali
00:14:05:200000.Dialogue: Yes-- Lakshmi just got her stomach stapled.

00:14:10:070000.Speaker: Dr Koothrappali
00:14:10:070000.Dialogue: You have an opportunity to get in good with her before she loses weight, and her self-esteem goes up.

00:14:14:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:14:200000.Dialogue: I don't care! And why don't you think I can find a woman for myself?

00:14:18:200000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:14:18:200000.Dialogue: Because you're 27, and the closest thing we have to a daughter-in-law is that Jewish boy Howard.

00:14:23:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:23:170000.Dialogue: Oh..that is completely below the belt.

00:14:27:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:27:010000.Dialogue: Sheldon, tell my parents that Howard and I are just friends.

00:14:31:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:31:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon? Howard and I are just friends!

00:14:38:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:38:080000.Dialogue: Fine. I'll come home for Sanjay's wedding.

00:14:50:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:50:010000.Dialogue: What are you doing? He's not a lost dog.

00:14:52:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:52:070000.Dialogue: Hey, why don't you just let me find him while you sit there hitting your imaginary brake?

00:14:56:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:56:230000.Dialogue: The brake might be imaginary, but that stop sign you just ran wasn't.

00:15:02:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:02:030000.Dialogue: Eyes on the road. Eyes on the road!

00:15:13:170000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
00:15:13:170000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:15:13:170000.Dialogue: MOTHER: Howard, answer the door! I'm busy!

00:15:18:030000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
00:15:18:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:18:030000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: I'm busy too. You answer it.

00:15:20:190000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
00:15:20:190000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:15:20:190000.Dialogue: MOTHER: I can't! I'm on the toilet!

00:15:23:100000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
00:15:23:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:23:100000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: For God's sake, I don't need to hear that! Can't you just say, "I'm busy"?

00:15:28:170000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
00:15:28:170000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:15:28:170000.Dialogue: MOTHER: I said I'm busy, but that wasn't good enough for you!

00:15:32:040000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
00:15:32:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:32:040000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: You know what? I hope it's one of those home invasion deals, And they shove me in the head.

00:15:37:010000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
00:15:37:010000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:15:37:010000.Dialogue: MOTHER: Well, if it's a home invader, don't tell them I'm on the toilet!

00:15:45:050000.Scene: Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
00:15:45:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:45:050000.Dialogue: There's no one there. You're hearing things, you crazy old lady!

00:15:54:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:54:010000.Dialogue: Hey, Stuart, have you seen Sheldon?

00:15:55:210000.Speaker: Stuart
00:15:55:210000.Dialogue: Yeah, he's, uh, over in the graphic novel section. Built himself a little nest.

00:16:08:170000.Speaker: Stuart
00:16:08:170000.Dialogue: Uh, Sheldon told me you and Leonard were having a fight?

00:16:11:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:11:070000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, kind of. It's-It's no big thing.

00:16:14:130000.Speaker: Stuart
00:16:14:130000.Dialogue: Oh, good, good. I love you.

00:16:19:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:19:170000.Dialogue: I'm not leaving until you talk to me.

00:16:23:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:23:100000.Dialogue: It's a little hard to explain. He does this thing where he pretends he's in an alternate dimension that occupies the same physical space we're in, but he can't perceive us.

00:16:33:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:33:050000.Dialogue: Don't flatter yourself. I'm just ignoring you.

00:16:37:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:37:230000.Dialogue: Come on, Sheldon, let's go home. Look, we're done fighting.

00:16:41:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:41:130000.Dialogue: I've heard that before. But then, the next thing you know, I'm hiding in my bedroom, blaring a Richard Feinman lecture while my mom is shouting that Jesus would forgive her if she put ground glass in my dad's meatloaf. And my dad's on the roof skeet-shooting her Franklin Mint collectible plates.

00:16:58:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:58:180000.Dialogue: There's going to no more shouting and no skeet-shooting.

00:17:02:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:02:120000.Dialogue: Really? Where's your friend Justin going to sleep?

00:17:07:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:07:210000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, would you let this go?!

00:17:13:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:13:020000.Dialogue: Why should I let it go? Why don't you just tell the guy to find another place to sleep?!

00:17:18:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:18:170000.Dialogue: Oh, for God's sakes. So, you have childhood issues. We all have childhood issues. At some point, you just need to grow up and get past them.

00:17:31:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:31:210000.Dialogue: Leonard, will you just let me handle this, please? Again! Fire! Fire! Let... just...Look...

00:17:42:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:42:050000.Dialogue: Sheldon, please, try and understand. Look, Leonard and I are in a relationship, and occasionally, we're going to fight. But no matter what happens between us, we will always love you.

00:18:03:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:03:080000.Dialogue: You know, how about we buy you this robot, and then we all go home?

00:18:10:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:10:170000.Dialogue: Okay, you can have that one.

00:18:12:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:12:110000.Dialogue: Oh, come on, he's just going to play with it twice, and then it'll end up in his closet with all the other junk.

00:18:23:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:23:050000.Dialogue: Can I get this comic book, too?

00:18:42:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:42:060000.Dialogue: So what did Justin say when you told him he couldn't sleep on your couch?

00:18:45:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:45:160000.Dialogue: He's a musician. He'll sleep in his own vomit, if he has to.

00:18:58:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:58:110000.Dialogue: I should have asked for much more than a comic book and a robot.
